qas.question: Substandard what is often one way for corruption to enter the construction field?
What happens with contracts to aid corruption?
Recipients of aid are concerned about what?
Those receiving aid may have connections, pay bribes or what?
Corrupt people may manipulate what to receive more assistance?

context: In construction and shelter there are numerous opportunities for diversion and profit through substandard <a0_0>workmanship<a0_0/>, <a1_0>kickbacks<a1_0/> for contracts and favouritism in the provision of valuable shelter material. Thus while humanitarian aid agencies are usually most concerned about aid being diverted by including too many, recipients themselves are most concerned about <a2_0>exclusion<a2_0/>. Access to aid may be limited to those with connections, to those who pay bribes or are <a3_0>forced to give sexual favors<a3_0/>. Equally, those able to do so may manipulate <a4_0>statistics<a4_0/> to inflate the number of beneficiaries and siphon off additional assistance.
